benchmark_details.name: VIVA (A Benchmark for Vision-Grounded Decision-Making with Human Values)
benchmark_details.overview: VIVA is a benchmark aimed at evaluating vision-grounded decision-making capabilities of vision language models (VLMs) driven by human values. The benchmark contains 1,240 images depicting various real-world situations along with manually annotated decisions grounded in them.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate vision-grounded decision-making capabilities of VLMs with a focus on human values.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The data annotation tends to be brief, potentially limiting depth. Additionally, human values may vary culturally.

data.source: Images collected from open-sourced platforms like Pinterest and Reddit.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by skilled annotators with support from language models.

methodology.calculation: Combined accuracy of both action selection and value inference tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better decision-making capabilities aligned with human values.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline accuracy for action selection is 20%, and for value inference is 50%.
methodology.validation: Extensive evaluations on both commercial and open-source VLMs.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of demographic factors is included to assess fairness across groups.
targeted_risks.harm: The benchmark aims to identify potential biases and improve decision-making alignment with human values.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All images sourced from public domains, ensuring compliance with copyright.
